pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw: I thought that `open /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app` would work, but it doesn't seem to work actually. For the X server to be used by Jenkins, the Jenkins user must be logged in to the GUI and the Xquartz app must be opened from the GUI. I'm not sure how to fix it.
content.html: I thought that open /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app would work, but it doesn't seem to work actually. For the X server to be used by Jenkins, the Jenkins user must be logged in to the GUI and the Xquartz app must be opened from the GUI. I'm not sure how to fix it.

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw:
Some info about grepping the `ps ax`:
~~~
$ ps ax | grep X
  226   ??  S      0:12.09 /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app/Contents/MacOS/X11.bin -psn_0_32776
  301   ??  S      0:00.00 /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/launchd_startx /opt/X11/bin/startx -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz
  302   ??  S      0:00.01 /bin/sh /opt/X11/bin/startx -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz
  354   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/xinit /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/xinitrc -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
  355   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
  367   ??  S      0:00.26 /opt/X11/bin/quartz-wm
  469   ??  Ss     0:00.03 com.apple.appstore.PluginXPCService
~~~

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw:
We want to isolate the line:
~~~
  355   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
~~~
since this is the X instance owned by jenkins
content.html:
We want to isolate the line:

  355   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302

since this is the X instance owned by jenkins

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw: Also, there will be multiple display variables created when multiple users have opened Xquartz
content.html: Also, there will be multiple display variables created when multiple users have opened Xquartz

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw:
Testing this on linux grep, the d wildcard is not working. Something like:

`| grep '[[:digit:]]*:[[:digit:]][[:digit:]].[[:digit:]][[:digit:]] /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz'`

is working on my linux box
content.html:
Testing this on linux grep, the d wildcard is not working. Something like:

| grep '[[:digit:]]*:[[:digit:]][[:digit:]].[[:digit:]][[:digit:]] /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz'

is working on my linux box

Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw:
Here's a better example, with multiple users running X:
~~~
t1000:~ osrf$ ps ax | grep X
  226   ??  S      0:12.13 /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app/Contents/MacOS/X11.bin -psn_0_32776
  301   ??  S      0:00.00 /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/launchd_startx /opt/X11/bin/startx -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz
  302   ??  S      0:00.01 /bin/sh /opt/X11/bin/startx -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz
  354   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/xinit /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/xinitrc -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
  355   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
  367   ??  S      0:00.27 /opt/X11/bin/quartz-wm
  469   ??  Ss     0:00.03 com.apple.appstore.PluginXPCService
57425   ??  S      0:01.27 /Applications/Utilities/XQuartz.app/Contents/MacOS/X11.bin -psn_0_839885
57472   ??  S      0:00.05 /opt/X11/bin/xterm
57473   ??  S      0:00.00 /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/launchd_startx /opt/X11/bin/startx -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz
57474   ??  S      0:00.01 /bin/sh /opt/X11/bin/startx -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz
57556   ??  Ss     0:00.00 /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/privileged_startx -d /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/privileged_startx.d
57596   ??  S      0:00.00 /opt/X11/bin/xinit /opt/X11/lib/X11/xinit/xinitrc -- /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :1 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/osrf/.serverauth.57474
57597   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :1 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/osrf/.serverauth.57474
57605   ??  S      0:00.05 /opt/X11/bin/quartz-wm
57733 s000  S+     0:00.00 grep X
~~~

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw:
To filter down the number of instances of Xquartz:
~~~
$ ps ax  | grep '[[:digit:]]*:[[:digit:]][[:digit:]].[[:digit:]][[:digit:]] /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz'
  355   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
57597   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :1 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/osrf/.serverauth.57474
~~~
Now you can see there are two instances with different users
content.html:
To filter down the number of instances of Xquartz:

$ ps ax  | grep '[[:digit:]]*:[[:digit:]][[:digit:]].[[:digit:]][[:digit:]] /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz'
  355   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :0 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/jenkins/.serverauth.302
57597   ??  S      0:00.01 /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz :1 -nolisten tcp -auth /Users/osrf/.serverauth.57474

Now you can see there are two instances with different users

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw:
The last line selects the display variable:
~~~
$ ps ax  
    | grep '[[:digit:]]*:[[:digit:]][[:digit:]].[[:digit:]][[:digit:]] /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz' \
    | sed -e 's@.*Xquartz @@' -e 's@ .*@@'
:0
:1

~~~
content.html:
The last line selects the display variable:

$ ps ax  
    | grep '[[:digit:]]*:[[:digit:]][[:digit:]].[[:digit:]][[:digit:]] /opt/X11/bin/Xquartz' \
    | sed -e 's@.*Xquartz @@' -e 's@ .*@@'
:0
:1

pullrequest.title: Improve display detection for jenkins homebrew jobs

content.raw: The middle grep is then needed to select the instance owned by the jenkins user
content.html: The middle grep is then needed to select the instance owned by the jenkins user
